channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report E-2023100229
item.description:
Report E-2023100229

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-19T15:12:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the metal 55gallon drum of tert- butyl acetate (un1123) releasing 0.5 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023100439
item.description:
Report E-2023100439

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-16T18:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-14
  • City: RIVERSIDE
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading at the client's site it was discovered that one of the metal 55 gallon drum of dabco NE300 (un2735) had released one cup of product near the bottom seam. The driver was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023080008
item.description:
Report X-2023080008

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-29
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 003/KCI RECIEVED SHIPMENT ON TRAILER, MOVED TRAILER FROM ONE SIDE OF YARD TO THE OTHER AND PARKED IN FRONT OF DOCK ~DOOR 92. THEY QUICKLY REALIZED IT WAS LEAKING OUT OF THE TRAILER AND IT SMELLED. THE SPILL WAS IN THE YARD, IN THE ~DRAIN, ON THE MOBILE PLATFORM.
